sponsor: University Hospital Virgen de las Nieves
briefTitle: Pressure Ulcer Prevention in Ventilated Patients Using Two Repositioning Regimens
officialTitle: Comparison of Two Turning Regimens (2 Versus Every 4 Hours) in the Prevention of Pressure Ulcers in Patients on Mechanical Ventilation That Use Alternating-pressure Air Mattresses.
summary: The purpose of this study is to compare a 2-hour versus every 4-hour turning regimen on the incidence of grade \> II pressure ulcers (PU) in patients in ICU on mechanical ventilation ≥ 24h that use alternating-pressure air mattresses (APAMs).

primaryOutcome.measure: Incidence of Pressure Ulcer (PU) Grade ≥ II
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Intensive Care Unit (ICU) length of stay (days)
